description: Factorial splitting: write n! = x*y with x<y and x maximal; sequence gives value of x.
comments: This is essentially the same as A060776; n! is never a perfect square for n>1 so there is always an even number of divisors of n!, so we can list its divisors in increasing order as [d1,d2,...,x,y,...,dk] with x and y the median divisors (A060776 and A060777, respectively). - Nathaniel Johnston, Jun 25 2011a(27)=104348440350000, a(28)=552160113120000. [From _Zak Seidov_, Jul 07 2009]
maple: A061055 := proc(n) local d: d:=numtheory[divisors](n!): return d[nops(d)/2]: end: seq(A061055(n),n=2..15); # Nathaniel Johnston, Jun 25 2011
mathematica: Do[ With[ {k = Floor[ Sqrt[ x! ] ] - Do[ If[ Mod[ x!, Floor[ Sqrt[ x! ] ] - n ] == 0, Return[ n ] ], {n, 0, 10000000} ]}, Print[ {x, "! =", k, x!/k, x!/k - k} ] ], {x, 3, 22} ]
